main_text:
Philosophy of Mind
4. Philosophy of Mind

Śrīharṣa is eager to point out that he is not
skeptical of all commonsense ontological categories (KKh 62–63).
Consciousness, for him, is ultimately real; only the world,
insofar as it appears distinct from consciousness, isn’t. What
reason do we have for treating consciousness as ultimately real?
Śrīharṣa answers this question by defending a positive
proposal about self-knowledge and intentionality. This section
discusses that proposal.
